helpdata.line: Adds a hostmask to a user's user record. Hostmasks are used
to identify your username on IRC. If a username is not specified,
the hostmask will be added to YOUR user record.
Removes a hostmask from a user's user record. Hostmasks are used
to identify your username on IRC. If a username is not specified,
the hostmask will be removed from YOUR user record.
Adds a new user record with the specified handle.
Removes the specified handle from the userlist.
This lets you change the flags for a user. If a channel is
specified, flags will be modified for that channel instead of
globally. The channel does not have to exist.
Kills the bot. If you specify a reason, that reason will be
logged and also used as the bot's quit message from the IRC
server.
Shows the value of a configuration setting.
For example:
.get server.realname
Current value: 'Mr. Egg Drop'
To get the value of a setting which is part of a list, specify
its item number in square brackets ([]) after its name.
For example:
.get eggdrop.autoload.module[0]
Current value: 'telnetparty'
Sets a new value for the specified configuration setting.
For example:
.set server.realname Mr. Egg Drop
Old value: '1.7 Test Bot'
New value: 'Mr. Egg Drop'
If you don't specify a new value, then the setting will be
unset (null).
